question: This is the mediant in F major <image 1>
description: The image shows a musical staff with a treble clef at the beginning. On this staff, there is a single note placed on the second line from the bottom. This note has a flat symbol (♭) immediately to its left. The note itself is an A, which is indicated by its position on the staff. Therefore, the note depicted is an A-flat (A♭).
